data.title: Everything you need to know about the Olivier Awards
data.meta_description: Find out more about the Olivier Awards.
data.text:
London's West End theatres showcase world-class plays, musicals, and entertainment every night of the year. Every month, new productions open across the capital, and many actors give award-winning performances. To honour the exceptional London shows, the Society of London Theatre celebrates the very best in West End theatre at the Olivier Awards.

The Olivier Awards are dedicated to recognising high quality performances in West End shows, operas, and dance productions. If a production wins multiple Olivier Awards, then it's likely the show will become a West End long-runner, playing to audiences for years to come.

Named the Society of West End Theatre Awards in 1976, London productions strive to win some of theatre's highest honours. The ceremony adopted the current name — the Laurence Olivier Awards — in 1984, after British actor Laurence Olivier. Ahead of the 2022 Olivier Awards, discover more about the Olivier Awards ceremonies, eligible productions, and who will win Olivier Awards.

Book tickets to Olivier Award-winning shows on London Theatre.

What Olivier Award-winning shows are in London now?

Many 2022 Olivier Award-winning shows and 2023 Olivier Award-nominated shows are currently running in London. Book your tickets now to the latest shows to earn critical acclaim.

Cabaret

Cabaret won seven Olivier Awards, including all four musical acting categories for its company: Eddie Redmayne, Jessie Buckley, Elliot Levey, and Liza Sadovy.

Book Cabaret tickets on London Theatre.

Back to the Future: The Musical

Back to the Future: The Musical won Best New Musical at the 2022 Olivier Awards. See Back to the Future: The Musical at the Adelphi Theatre.

Book Back to the Future: The Musical tickets on London Theatre.

Moulin Rouge! The Musical

Moulin Rouge! The Musical won one Olivier from its five nominations, picking up the award for Best Costume Design.

Book Moulin Rouge! The Musical tickets on London Theatre.

A Streetcar Named Desire

A Streetcar Named Desire won three Oliviers: Best Revival, Best Actress in a Supporting Role (Anjana Vasan,) and Best Actor (Paul Mescal.)

Book A Streetcar Named Desire tickets on London Theatre.

Patriots

Patriots won one Olivier: Best Actor in a Supporting Role (Will Keen.)

Book Patriots tickets on London Theatre.

Sylvia

Sylvia won one Olivier: Best Actress in a Supporting Role in a Musical (Beverley Knight).

Book Sylvia tickets on London Theatre.

Oklahoma!

Oklahoma! won two Olivier Awards: Best Musical Revival, Best Actor in a Musical (Arthur Darvill.)

Book Oklahoma! tickets on London Theatre.

Newsies

Newsies's Matt Cole won the Olivier Award for Best Choreographer.

What are the Olivier Awards?

The Olivier Awards are given out at an awards ceremony that acknowledges exceptional theatre performances in the West End and London. The Olivier Awards are the most prestigious awards ceremony in the West End's theatre calendar and are similar to the Tony Awards on Broadway, as they both give honours to exceptional productions.

When are the Olivier Awards?

The 2023 Olivier Awards will take place on 2 April 2023. Typically, the Olivier Awards are held in April and mark the end of a year of theatre. This year, the Olivier Awards will be held on the first Sunday in April.

Where are the Olivier Awards taking place?

The 2023 Olivier Awards will take place at the Royal Albert Hall. The Olivier Awards were first held at the Royal Albert Hall in 2017, and this tradition has continued for all in-person ceremonies since.

Previous ceremonies have been at the Royal Opera House and many West End theatres, including the Dominion Theatre, London Palladium, Lyceum Theatre, National Theatre, Piccadilly Theatre, Shaftesbury Theatre, Theatre Royal Drury Lane and Victoria Palace Theatre.

The Royal Albert Hall is known for holding the BBC Proms concerts each summer. Over 1.7 million people visit the Royal Albert Hall each year, and the venue is home the buzziest night in the theatre calendar — the Olivier Awards.

What time are the Olivier Awards?

Timings for the 2023 Olivier Awards will be announced at a later date. The Olivier Awards will take place in the evening.

How can I watch the Olivier Awards?

If you want to keep up with the latest Olivier Awards news as it happens, follow London Theatre on Twitter.

What does an Olivier Award look like?

Winning an Olivier Award isn't just verbal praise. Olivier Award winners also receive a bronze statue. The Olivier Award statue is a cast of Laurence Olivier in Henry V at the Old Vic in 1937, and the design is commissioned by the Society of London Theatre. Olivier Awards statues aren't small either! They weigh 1.6 kilograms.

How many categories are in the Olivier Awards?

There are 27 categories in the 2022 Olivier Awards. 21 awards are for theatre productions, with a further two awards for opera, two awards for dance, and one for productions in affiliate theatres. The Special Award is also given each year to a different actor. The Olivier Award categories are as follows:

What are affiliate venues in the Olivier Awards?

As well as the 54 venues that can house Olivier-eligible productions, some venues can submit productions as an "affiliate." Who is nominated for the 2023 Olivier Awards?

Shows with multiple nominations include My Neighbour Totoro and Standing at the Sky's Edge. Check out all the 2023 Olivier Awards nominations on London Theatre.

Who is hosting the 2023 Olivier Awards?

Hannah Waddingham will host the 2023 Olivier Awards. The Emmy-winning actress is best known for playing Rebecca Welton in Ted Lasso. Her West End credits include Spamalot, Kiss Me Kate, and Into The Woods. Find out more about Hannah Waddingham hosting the Oliviers.

Who is performing at the 2023 Olivier Awards?

All of the Best New Musical nominees will perform: Standing At The Sky's Edge, Sylvia, Tammy Faye, and The Band's Visit. Newsies, nominated for Best Choreography, will take to the stage, as well as musical revivals Oklahoma! and Sister Act.

The Book of Mormon will perform to mark the show's 10th anniversary. There'll also be a tribute to Grease to honour choreographer Arlene Philips.

Who won the 2023 Olivier Awards?

The 2023 Olivier Awards winners will be revealed at an in-person ceremony at the Royal Albert on 2 April 2023. My Neighbour Totoro won six Olivier Awards. Find out the full list of Olivier winners.
